item.title: About me
item.description: I’m Liz Karan, an evolutionary biologist whose work aims to understand how the diversity we observe across reef fishes came to be. I’m interested in comparative methods, developing high-throughput tools for macroevolutionary studies, and ecological applications of machine learning. I’m currently a PhD Candidate at the University of California, Los Angeles with Michael Alfaro, PhD.
